thread.title: Early Bengals practice report: Jones, Iloka, Whitworth sit out
thread.title_full: Early Bengals practice report: Jones, Iloka, Whitworth sit out

title: Early Bengals practice report: Jones, Iloka, Whitworth sit out
text:
Early Bengals practice report: Jones, Iloka, Whitworth sit out 
Updated: Wed, Sep 30 2015, 01:37 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- The Bengals appeared pretty healthy as they began on-field preparations on Wednesday for Sunday's game against the Kansas City Chiefs in Paul Brown Stadium. 
It appeared that only three players were not going to practice on Wednesday: cornerback Adam Jones, left tackle Andrew Whitworth and safety George Iloka. 
Jones suffered an elbow injury in Sunday's 28-24 win at Baltimore when he was tackled returning the opening kickoff of the second half. Jones appeared to be in significant pain both as he was treated on the field and while on the sidelines as the offense was on the field, but returned for the first defensive snap of the second half and played the rest of the game. 
Whitworth is likely taking a veteran's day off as he has done at least one day per week this season and did almost every week last season. 
Iloka took himself out of Sunday's game with an ankle injury and was replaced by Shawn Williams. Iloka played 43 defensive snaps in the game and Williams played 31. 
Cornerback Dre Kirkpatrick it appeared was going to be a limited participant in Wednesday's practice. He got dinged up while tackling Ravens wide receiver Steve Smith as he went into the end zone on Sunday, but didn't miss a single defensive snap in the game. 
The team will release the official practice participation report when practice concludes around 1:15 p.m.
